Court of Appeals of Texas, Waco.

*512 Scott Peterson, Waco, for appellant.
Don W. Cantrell, County Atty., Roy De Friend, Asst. County Atty., Groesbeck, for appellee.
Before THOMAS, C.J., and CUMMINGS and VANCE, JJ.

OPINION ON STATE'S MOTION FOR REHEARING
VANCE, Justice.
After our January 8, 1992, opinion was issued, the State filed a motion for rehearing, asserting that we had incorrectly designated aggravated assault as a second-degree *513 felony and that, because the facts show that Johnson could be guilty of only first-degree aggravated assault, no charge on aggravated assault was required. We scheduled oral argument on the State's motion. Because our earlier opinion was incomplete, we withdraw it and substitute this opinion.
Johnson was convicted by a jury of attempted capital murder; the judge sentenced him to life in prison. See TEX.PENAL CODE ANN. § 15.01 (Vernon Supp.1992) & § 19.03(a)(1) (Vernon 1989). By three points, he asserts that the court erred in failing to charge the jury on (1) the lesserincluded offense of aggravated assault, (2) the lesser-included offense of reckless conduct, and (3) the law of self-defense. We will reverse the judgment and remand for a new trial.
